column1: '''When the black breath blows''' is a poem of herblore spoken by the herb-master of the [[Houses of Healing]] in the chapter "[[The Houses of Healing]]". It is an old rhyme telling of the healing properties of [[athelas]]
column2: though it is considered by some to be little more than an old wives' tale despite the truth of its words.

column1: '''2011: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: War in the North]]'' '''
The poem is recounted by one of the healers at [[Halbarad]]'s encampment at [[Sarn Ford]]
column2: though "athelas" is here mispronounced as "ah-THAY-lus" rather than "ATH-e-lass" as the poem would suggest.
